attributes.action: Retain an Armed Forces presence at Wrexham’s Hightown Barracks.
attributes.background:
The "Army 2020 Refine" strategy may relocate a Wrexham-based  REME unit to Bristol.  

Wrexham's proud to be a garrison town. The Armed Forces is an integral part of our history and culture.   

There is no shortage of evidence to suggest that the Wrexham Community supports the Armed Forces.
attributes.additional_details: A strong presence on Armistice Day and Remembrance Sunday is testament to the Wrexham Community’s high regard for the Armed Forces.   In 2016, when veterans expressed a wish for their association standards to be preserved, the people of Wrexham recognised the importance of protecting our veterans' legacy, and raised almost £12,000 to make this possible.
attributes.creator_name: Councillor David Griffiths.  Armed Forces Champion.  Wrexham County Borough Council.

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to regulate Speedway Clubs and Teams
attributes.background: Currently Speedway is run by the British Speedway Promotors Association, however we feel that this body of people are not running the Speedway sport in the interest of the riders or the fans, this is because the body of people are formed by the speedway promotors who own the clubs.
attributes.additional_details:
Because the sport is run by people who own the clubs, decisions and rules are made individually to suit their needs, and what will make them make more money or save them loosing money. 

The pay and working conditions for riders are very poor, this is not what fans pay to see.

attributes.action: Fund a railway/tram system to link Newcastle, Gateshead & Durham with Consett
attributes.background: The UK Government should fund the building of a light railway or tram system to link these areas.  This will help to regenerate Derwentside.

attributes.action: To get the government to look at the miners pension on the 50/50 surplus
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the UK Government to review the 'Mineworkers Pension' to reduce from the 50/50 sharing of the surpluses that the Government are taking from the system. It has been a number of years since the mineworkers and widows have had an increase in their pension.
attributes.additional_details: We are fighting for the monies that both Labour and Tory Government have taken from the Miners since 1994/5. This money has been taken at a rate of 1m per-day,which equates to £8bn in total . We are looking to the people of the UK to support the miners in this fight as the mine workers have been the back bone of this country of a number of years.

attributes.action: Implement stronger sentences for those convicted of assaulting police officers
attributes.background: Assaults on police officers have dramatically risen, with officers frequently being attacked in the line of duty. Police officers put their lives on the line protecting citizens every day and the lack of respect that people who attack them show should be reflected through stronger sentences.
attributes.additional_details: I am a serving officer with the Metropolitan Police service and have heard about and witnessed first hand details of assaults on colleagues. Colleagues who whilst on patrol get spat at, bitten, punched, kicked, sometimes repeatedly, violently assaulted. Only today two police officers were admitted to hospital in London after being assaulted challenging a youth who was carrying a knife. Police officers need to be shown respect for serving the population, and this needs to be shown via sentencing

attributes.action: Focus primary school education on social skills and creativity rather than exams
attributes.background: The current curriculum focuses on tests and results. It is putting unacceptable pressure on young children. Many parents simply want schooling in primary years to focus on social skills, creativity and fun What value is there in creating highly educated but traumatised children?
attributes.additional_details: Mental health issues are soaring in children. Childline has reported a marked increase. Children face many pressures, some of which simply didn't exist for older generations. Piling additional pressures on children through rigorous testing achieves nothing but anxiety for both child and parent.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hare coursing
attributes.background: We should lift the ban on hare coursing as it is a great tradition and if we do defend and fight for them such as fox hunting then there will be none of this country's traditions left !!
attributes.additional_details: Once the dog gets hold of the hare it is dead unlike shooting wear you could injure the hare or unsuccessfully kill it straight away

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all mainline train services to carry a defibrillator
attributes.background: It is not currently mandatory for mainline train services to carry defibrillators. Defibrillators save lives.

attributes.action: We would like the UK to have an official National Emergency Services Day.
attributes.background:
Emergency services are often overlooked and forgotten about with regards to saying thank you for what you do.
We believe a National Emergency Services day should be held to recognise the good work our blue light services do.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the time when the public come into contact with emergency services, something bad has happened, this has a detrimental effect on both the public and members of the blue light community. By having an official National Emergency Services day and by holding community events across the country this would allow the public to engage and see another side of the great work they do.

attributes.action: Grant siblings access rights
attributes.background:
The decision about how much contact a sibling can have is controlled by the parents.
There are no legal guidelines and the support available can be costly(see below).
This results in many negative relationships which drives families apart.
attributes.additional_details:
After a family break up, parents have multiple options when it comes to contact, as well as legal guidelines in place to protect the best interest of the child.
Siblings have no legal rights to access. They can use mediation but failing that they can apply for a child contact order through the courts. This costs £215 just to apply! They also require permission to do this from a family court, as well as court fees.
www.gov.uk/looking-after-children-divorce/types-of-court-order

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt.
attributes.background: The budget for mental health trusts fell by 2% from 2013/14 to 2014/15. Also, in the year April 2016 the budget for mental health trusts was projected to rise by a dismal 0.3%. Jeremy Hunt is ruining our NHS, which was created after WW2 to assist people regardless of their socioeconomic background.
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned call upon parliament to hold a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt. Arguably, Jeremy Hunt is in breach of The National Health Service Act (S1) (1a). It states 'The Secretary of State must continue the promotion in England of a comprehensive health service designed to secure improvement in the physical and mental health of the people of England'. By cutting the budget of mental health trusts Jeremy Hunt is, potentially putting patients lives at risk; not promoting the NHS.

attributes.action: Elizabeth Truss to use her powers of executive clemency in the cases of 500 IPPs
attributes.background:
prisoners serving  (IPP) were "languishing in jail". IPP sentences, abolished in 2012, were having a serious effect on prisoners' mental health.
More than 3,800 prisoners are serving indeterminate IPP sentences, designed to protect the public
attributes.additional_details:
Truss to resume prison officer talks
Of those, 500 should be let go, former Justice Secretary Michael Gove said, when he delivered the annual Longford lecture in memory of prison reformer Lord Longford.

Mr Gove said executive clemency should be granted to release prisoners who had served far longer than the tariff for their offence and had now - after multiple parole reviews - served even longer than the maximum determinate sentence for that offence.

attributes.action: All school holidays to be the same
attributes.background: I would like to see all the school holidays to be the same . 2 of my Daughters go to different schools and I also work in one .April this year we all have different holidays. My holidays are as follows . 31/3/2017 -18/4/2017 ,My Daughters are...7/4/2017 -24/4/2017 , my  other Daughters ...12/4/2017
attributes.additional_details: How  can we possibly book a holiday when all 3 schools in the same town are all completely different.

attributes.action:
Michaela's Law
Make it law that all council run parks have CCTV in play areas
attributes.background: My 10 yr old daughter was seriously assaulted by a 45 yr old adult in July 2016.There wasn't CCTV and because of this my daughters attacker got away with it.If there had been CCTV my daughter and family wouldn't have had to go through what we are now.The long term psychological impact is devastating
attributes.additional_details: Please support this so that no other family has to go through what we are going through. Children should be safe guarded and protected in this day an age. All children are entitled to play freely and feel safe at all times.

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption, without crime!
attributes.background: I was abused as a child and domestically, as a result I have PTSD. Although I left my partner, moved far away from my family, made great improvements with my ptsd, and had support, my newborn was taken at birth, and has been placed for adoption without my consent, based on a risk of emotional harm
attributes.additional_details:
This dismisses the law, and rights to a private and family life. And it dismisses the rights of my son, who has the right to be within his birth family.
I have committed no crime to anyone, adult or child. I have no addictions.
The law should be changed , so that no child can be taken without parental consent, if no crime has been committed and if there are no addictions. Instead family's should be worked with and supported to be a family by child services before any further action is considered

attributes.action: Overturn Chris Grayling's plan to create a road tunnel under Stonehenge on A303
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a World Heritage Site, famous worldwide. It is also a Part of OUR heritage and a Sacred Site to the Druids. The plan could cause irreparable damage to the site and cause it to be lost to future generations forever.
attributes.additional_details:
Last year, the historians Dan Snow and Tom Holland attacked the proposals, likening them to vandals destroying ancient artefacts. “We have recently started to realise that the standing stones are just a beginning. They sit at the heart of the world’s most significant and best-preserved stone-age landscape. The government’s plans endanger this unique site,” he said. 
Holland said: “There is so much waiting to be learned about how Stonehenge was built – if we decide, as a country, not to sacrifice it to road building. The battle to save our most significant neolithic landscape is an unending one.”

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Protect access to state funded benefits and services for humanitarian workers.
attributes.background: Humanitarian workers who serve oversea with registered charities are discriminated against and do not have the same access to publicly funded benefits and services that UK dwelling people do. Their service in the national interest means that they no longer meet presence based qualification criteria.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of their contribution to the national interest certain categories of workers, like military personnel and public servants, have their access to benefits and service protected when living overseas in the line of duty. Thus they are treated by legislation as being physically present in the UK, even when overseas. This protection of rights to access state funded assistance or services, from discretionary or mandatory disqualification, should be extended to humanitarian workers.

attributes.action: Substantiate or retract the Prime Minister's Brexit White Paper introduction.
attributes.background: The PM claims in her Brexit White Paper introduction that an overwhelming majority of people want the Government to get on with Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: No matter what happens with Brexit, British values cannot be served by a post-truth, alternative-facts approach to Government.  Democracy is undermined when unsubstantiated and unverified statements on the views of the electorate are allowed to influence Government decisions.   Unless the Prime Minister has evidence to support her conclusion on the will of an overwhelming majority of people, her opening statement in the Brexit White Paper must be amended accordingly.

attributes.action: Put restrictions on the amount of packaging used by British supermarkets.
attributes.background: In the light of the varied problems of climate change and waste disposal, it is inexcusable that supermarkets produce vast quantities of unnecessary packaging. Consumables, such as fruit and vegetables, confectionery and ready meals, do not need to be enclosed in multiple layers of plastic.
attributes.additional_details: Estimates put our annual levels of waste from packaging at around 5 mega-tonnes, this constitutes between a quarter and a third of our domestic waste. Responsibility for disposal and recycling of over-packaging should not be put on the consumer. Packaging to enclose goods such as bananas or tomatoes is entirely avoidable whilst for other products, such as confectionery, multiple layers of packaging are often used where one would suffice.

attributes.action: Redefine Children Act 1989 allow both biological mothers & fathers equal rights
attributes.background: Parental Responsibility (PR) as defined in the Children Act 1989 (CA 89) has caused so much misery and in extreme cases death of parents and children, there must be an equal 50/50 responsibilities and authorities in relation to the child and the child’s property for biological parents .

attributes.action: That MPs should debate and vote on an inquiry into the events at Orgreve
attributes.background: they has been a lot of distrust between workers and the police due to the suspicion that the events on 18 June 1984 between police and pickets at a British Steel Corporation plant in Orgreave, South Yorkshire.

attributes.action: Stop parents who maliciously deny the other parent access to their children
attributes.background: There are many examples of one parent who stops the other parent from having access to their own children for no good reason other than their own gain and take no consideration of the best interests of their children as often the children will have a strong relationship with the alienated parent
attributes.additional_details: When this happens there can be a long wait for resolution through mediation and/or courts of months. Before any formal hearings take place, it should be illegal for parents to do this and revision of the children and families act is required to give police greater powers of discretion to enforce equal contact where malicious behaviour is proven. Currently there is no support for alienated parents in the interim period before formal proceedings. This must change and made criminal.

attributes.action: Integrate reCAPTCHA so signatures are legitimate rather than bot scripted.
attributes.background: If media agencies are going to quote the numbers of signatories as being indicative of public support then this website needs to do more to ensure that bots can't sign it. Using Google's free reCAPTCHA service would be a simple way of stripping out the vast majority of bots.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of joined up handwriting in primary school SAT's.
attributes.background: There is currently an epidemic of illegible handwriting in our secondary schools. Primary schools have been forced to cut corners, using a continuous cursive method from Reception to simply tick the boxes of the handwriting statements in the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework.
attributes.additional_details: There is no long term benefit to this; it is simply to meet the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework handwriting statements, which contradicts the handwriting statements in the current National Curriculum. Also, we believe that it should be a statutory requirement that left handed pupils receive specific teaching to meet their needs, to help them master legible handwriting and continue to love writing.

attributes.action: Replace House of Lords with an elected house with advisory functions only.
attributes.background: The newly elected house would consist of a total of 100 representatives holding elections at the same time as a general election.  This would make the second house fully accountable to the electorate.  This would prevent the second house from subverting the will of the UK electorate.

attributes.action: Install adequate road lighting on the A249 sittingbourne
attributes.background:
Night time driving is never easy,  and unlit roads are a major hazard to all of us using them at night. 
The A249, sittingbourne is a perfect example of this problem.  Something needs to be done before more accidents happen!!!!
attributes.additional_details: From the m20, onto the A249, past Detling Hill through to keycole roundabout, the lighting at night is ridiculously poor & so dangerous to drivers using this stretch of road at night. There is no street lighting & also no cats eyes on the road, and road markings are very worn and near invisable

attributes.action: Amend animal welfare act to ban the practice of giving away animals as prizes.
attributes.background:
Calling upon the ban of ALL animals given as prizes to any age not just under the age of 16. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 in England and Wales makes it an offence to give away an animal as a prize if the person can reasonably be believed to be under 16 and is not accompanied by an adult.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the case in Scotland, where under the Animal Health and Welfare (Scotland) Act 2006, it is an offence to offer or give an animal to another person as a prize (whatever their age), except where it is offered in a family context.

attributes.action: Make Personal Independence Payment (PIP) claims fairer for adults with Autism.
attributes.background: Those with Autism (ASD) can find verbalising difficulties challenging. When considering PIP, the DWP should more carefully assess those with social and communication difficulties, by discussing more with medical professionals, rather than relying on the opinions of an assessor who briefly met them.
attributes.additional_details: My husband moved over from highest level care and lowest level mobility Disability Living Allowance, to the the new PIP system. He has a number of conditions including ASD and mental health difficulties, yet scored 0 on his PIP claim, and as a direct result became suicidal. Those with ASD can mask difficulties, and behaviours can vary; how can an assessment which takes place in their own home environment, with their trusted person present, be a true representation of their usual daily struggles?

attributes.action: Help ensure Volkswagen service action is not damaging vehicles
attributes.background: Volkswagen (VAG) mislead regulators and customers regarding the cheat device. There is now anecdotal evidence that the fix offered is causing damage to vehicles: http://uk.reuters.com/article/us-volkswagen-emissions-idUKKCN12S13Y
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government should work with the German Government and other EU partners to do all it can to ensure that the fix, which was approved by the KBA (German type approval authority), is not damaging vehicles and provide assurance to UK customers. The UK Government should also publish the information it has on the outcome of any tests on the VW fix.

attributes.action: Keep tinker lane greenfield and the rest of Nottinghamshire clean from fracking
attributes.background: I am a mother to my 3 year old daughter, a farmer’s daughter and a resident of Bassetlaw. We never want to see any land used for high pressure hydraulic fracking in this area. This company is happy to gain much from this while we all stand to gain nothing.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want my daughter ingesting methane and being exposed to chemicals. We want her to have the best start in life. She is at her most vulnerable stage and for me to be able to protect her we need to stop Igas who want to destroy the land which my family and others make a living from by growing food. Polluting this greenfield land will be catastrophic on a local level and national level. This soil grows carrots, barley, wheat, peas and potatoes on it. We believe clean healthy food is important.

attributes.action: Stop Plans to Close and Franchise 37 Crown Post Office Branches
attributes.background: The Post Office has announced it will close 37 of its Crown Post Office branches and seeking to franchise them into existing retailers. This risks 427 jobs; loss in services, accessibility; as well as having a detrimental effect on local high streets. These community assets must be protected.

attributes.action: Remove Council Tax Payments for families earning below £22000 a year.
attributes.background: Council tax is forever growing year upon year. With each new financial tax year we see it rise by a percentage every year. When will it become tone expensive to pay. Why do we have to pay such high tariffs. NOW is the time to help struggling families who scrape every penny together.

attributes.action: Make Bromethalin rat poison illegal in the U.K. Because of the dangers to pets
attributes.background: On Friday the 14th of October 2016 I found my cat grubby and walking into things,she was a wild cat and was always outside.we noticed she was walking into things and her eyes looked weird, we realised she was blind. We brought her to the vet and they referred us to the hospital.
attributes.additional_details: On Friday the 14th of October 2016 I found my cat grubby and walking into things,she was a wild cat and was always outside.we noticed she was walking into things and her eyes looked weird, we realised she was blind. We brought her to the vet and they referred us to the hospital for her they said they would keep her over night, we got a call the next morning.she had been sick green stuff and she was much worse the vet said she was poisoned by a type of rat poison and we had to put her down.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate whether it is possible to make a success of leaving the EU.
attributes.background: The Government has repeatedly stated it is determined to "make a success" of Brexit. While 52% of eligible voters may have voted to leave the EU, mere determination to make a success out of Brexit is insufficient. The notion Brexit can be successful is not supported by evidence and must be debated.
attributes.additional_details: Potential consequences include the UK leaving the Single Market and the break-up of the UK (both contrary to pledges made in the Conservative Manifesto); a plunge in the value of sterling (which hit a 168-year low following the referendum); few trading partners (diplomats for India, Canada, the US & Australia have stated they prioritise the EU over the UK); the loss of sovereignty over Gilbratar (a red line for Spain in negotiations); no deal with the EU (the 18-month timeframe is unrealistic).

attributes.action: Ireland Re-unification Talks
attributes.background: As part of The government's Brexit talks, there should be a discussion about a possible Re-Unification of Ireland. As Northern Ireland will now be our only physical border with the EU, some kind of border controls will have to be implemented, to stop any unrestricted movement across the UK border.
attributes.additional_details: Might I suggest that there is a clause that after a specified period of time (say six years) since we have officially left the EU, the people of both Ireland & Northern Ireland can decide whether they would like their current situation to stay the same, Northern Ireland to reunify with Ireland, or whether The Republic of Ireland would like to rejoin the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Stop ALL spending by UK Gov on Foreign Aid and divert it to the Care Budget.
attributes.background: We can't afford to look after our own citizens, but still send money overseas, why?  We must no longer neglect our own citizens, who worked hard to build our country and paid into the very same system that now neglects them but sends money to countries that do not need it!
attributes.additional_details: Raising council tax to pay for care, when it will not be enough or guaranteed to actually be spent wisely on care (that's if it gets into the care pot at all!).  We need to focus on those that paid into the system and look at the ways we should be working with everyone in our communities to integrate care and develop more beneficial caring environments for the future benefit of all.

attributes.action: EU citizens rights only protected when British citizens rights protected.
attributes.background:
The British Government is not to protect EU citizens rights who live in the uk until the EU makes reciprocal arrangements to protect British citizens rights living in the EU.

This is a negotiating position and should not be given away. British citizens to be put first in all negotiations.
attributes.additional_details: The house of Lords and remain voters want to protect EU citizens in the UK before any reciprocal arrangement has been made to protect British citizens living in the EU. This weakens the UK negotiating position and can be used against the British government by the EU. This must be prevented.

attributes.action: Government to correct errors in the Brexit White Paper
attributes.background: The Brexit White paper contained a number of "Alt Facts".  It is important that matters of such importance are worded correctly and these must be corrected. Some details below but a thorough fact check must be done
attributes.additional_details:
1. 65 million people are not willing this to happen. At best it may be 17.4 million. Accurate figures needed. 
2. The statement "the country is coming together" is  a "nominalisation" in linguistic terms. Please expand as it appears to have been extracted from a song by The Beatles
3. The first statement is negative. It must be more positive e.g. "The negotiations will be a great success". 
4. The 14 week holiday promise must be paid holiday as is implied by the promise but not stated.

attributes.action: Make government help fund Silverstone Circuit so they can keep hosting F1
attributes.background: Silverstone is the home of Formula One, & motor racing in general. The British Grand Prix NEEDS to be kept at this historic track to help sustain the future of the sport. It's bad enough we, the fans, are unable to watch all races live on free-to-air, so to lose this too would be devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/formula1/38526002

https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2017/jan/05/future-f1-british-grand-prix-silverstone-in-doubt-hosting-costs

http://www.skysports.com/f1/news/12433/10719351/silverstone-considering-terminating-british-gp-contract

attributes.action: The GCSE curriculum should be changed back to the previous curriculum.
attributes.background: This is unjustifiable and stressful for adolescents .Students from ages 15-16 years old are being made to do a much harder GCSEs in Maths and English. What was considered a C back then is now a 'lower C'. Why did the previous students get to do easier GCSEs?
attributes.additional_details: Young Secondary School children are being forced into another ridiculous and unreasonable new GCSE system. It is atrocious that children from the previous year had controlled assessments in English and this years dont. The government have added more higher grades and less lower grades (9-1) which is aggravating and overwhelming for most students who want to get into collage to do A levels, putting pupils under pressure, which is very unhealthy.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to fine Funeral Vehicles.
attributes.background: I have been a Funeral Director for over a decade.You only get one funeral, so it has to be done right. It's an utter disgrace when funeral vehicles are issued parking fines. It makes our job even harder. I believe that ALL funeral vehicles should get the RESPECT they deserve.
attributes.additional_details: I want to ask Parliament to change the law, to make it illegal for local councils or private parking providers to issue parking fines to funeral vehicles.

attributes.action: Urge the NHS to back the 8-week blood sugar diet method to avoid T2 Diabetes.
attributes.background: Increasing numbers of people are recovering from type 2 diabetes without drugs using the nutrition based 8-week blood sugar diet method at a time when instances of limb amputations, blindness and other complications are rising dramatically.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1: "The 8-week blood sugar diet method" by Dr Michael Mosley and Prof. Roy Taylor

Reference 2: Colin Beattie MSP (successful use of this method)

Reference 3: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3404259/Eat-beat-diabetes-just-eight-weeks-s-life-changing-diet-help-avoid-reverse-Type-2-diabetes-best-s-tasty-way-health.html

attributes.action: Urge FIFA to overturn the England V Scotland Poppy Ban
attributes.background: FIFA want to stop players wearing Poppies at the game, as apparently it is a political statement?  How is honouring our Armed Forces doing this?  I feel the Government should urge FIFA to overturn this ban.

attributes.action: To resolve the NHS financial crisis divert foreign aid payments into the NHS
attributes.background: Our whole NHS system is at breaking point and needs more investment. The money has to come from somewhere so rather than give foreign aid money to developed countries who are not suffering a humanitarian crisis give the money to the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: If you don't know how bad things are watch the BBC documentary Hospital, try and get to see your GP or go to A&E and see how long you have to wait. Call an ambulance or simply watch the news - IT'S CHRYSTAL CLEAR THE NHS IS IN CRISIS!!

attributes.action: Increase  healthcare spending now to a minimum of 10.6% of GDP to save our NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS and Social Care are in crisis.Staff shortages abound; ambulances wait for blocked beds, but people need care at home, and social care is missing because of Government cuts to councils.  Don't let the crisis be a tragedy, raise our spending to the level of other G7s now.
attributes.additional_details: According to the King's Fund 8/6/16 the USA, Sweden,Germany,France,Belgium,Denmark,The Netherlands,Japan,Canada,Austria all spend more % of their GDP than we do. The G7 countries spend an average of 10.6%GDP. The NHS is currently being asked to cut millions of pounds via Sustainability Transformation Strategies at a time when the whole system is in crisis.Our NHS must be protected, it is the one thing which stands for Britain, that all citizens,no matter how poor,have access to free healthcare.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cages under 80x50cm for hamsters
attributes.background:
Thousands of hamsters are kept in cages not suitable. 
According to a pet shop "a cage sized 30X59cm is the biggest cage & is suitable to keep a hamster in as they don't grow much." Incorrect advice is being given to owners & millions of hamsters are living in cages that are not actually big enough
attributes.additional_details:
This leads to physical issues, chronic stress causing untamed behaviour & sadly, even worse.

The RSPCA's guideline is 80X50cm floor space as a minimum. There are thousands of cages smaller than this being sold every day as "permanent" homes for Syrian Hamsters by uneducated staff.

Cages sold as Large (30x59cm) are too small for permanent residence, the minimum recommended size for an adult Syrian should be 80x50cm. Lets be the voice for those that cant speak & improve the welfare of hamsters.

attributes.action: Include all domestic pets to the Road Traffic Act 1988
attributes.background: The Road Traffic Act 1988 states drivers must report incidents involving horse, cattle, ass, mule, sheep, pigs, goats and dogs. This was sufficient for these working animals at the time the legislation was set. In contemporary times, the government should add domestic companions to this list.
attributes.additional_details: A working animal, usually domesticated, is kept by humans and trained to perform tasks which tends to give them a special status within the law. Today there are a wide range of domestic animals kept in the UK who deserve to be included in the act. For example, today Cats are successfully used as companions for the sick and disabled in care programs. They have served in the agricultural sector and in the military over many years. The Act must be updated to reflect these modern relationships.

attributes.action: No Trump in the UK if he deports Muslim citizens from US with no terror links
attributes.background: We believe that the UK is a multicultural country and if Donald Trump begins to deport Muslim citizens from US with no terror links this is clearly for racial reasons. If the UK government allows him to enter this suggests that they agree with and support his policies.

attributes.action: Reinstate the weekly Widows' Pension (abolished in April 2001)
attributes.background: The weekly Widows' Pension was abolished in April 2001 and now the Conservative Government are delaying the payment of our State Pension which we and our employers have paid into and which is rightfully ours.
